alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Parker Valley; Southeast Yuma County; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 09 at 3:04PM MST until September 09 at 10:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall associated with the tropical system Kay. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arizona and California, including the following areas, in southwest Arizona, Parker and Yuma. In California, Imperial County, Joshua Tree NP, and Salton Sea. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Abundant moisture associated with the tropical system Kay will spread north into the area resulting in the possibility of heavy rainfall. Extended periods of moderate to heavy rain will be capable of producing rural and urban flooding, particularly across western Imperial and central Riverside Counties. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central La Paz; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Parker Valley; Southeast Yuma County; Yuma
